questions.question_text: When a service desk agent uses the Create Security Incident UI action from a regular incident, what occurs?

choices.A: The incident is marked resolved with an automatic security resolution code
choices.B: A security incident is raised on their behalf but only a notification is displayed
choices.D: The service desk agent is redirected to the Security Incident Catalog to complete the record producer
choices.C: A security incident is raised on their behalf and displayed to the service desk agent

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
A security incident is raised on their behalf but only a notification is displaye

Selected Answer: B
Vancouver ebook p. 72: "A SI is raised on their behald but only a notification is displayed..."

Selected Answer: B
Correct answer is B. 
Tested this on a PDI with the Vancouver release.

Selected Answer: B
Correct answer is B.
According to eBook page 60:

A security Incident is raised on their behalf but only a notification is displayed, and not that due to confidentiality policies, they may not be able to see information on the security Incident once raised.

Selected Answer: B
tested in course provided SN instance.
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
sORRY B IS CORRECT

Selected Answer: C
C IS CORRECT
i TESTED IT ON MY INSTANCE
Event [em_event] table has the column "Classification".

Selected Answer: B
B is correct:
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-operations-management/page/product/it-operations-management/reference/r_ITOMApplications.html

Selected Answer: C
Security classification

comments.content: Sorry B. The re is no field called security

questions.question_text: Which of the following fields is used to identify an Event that is to be used for Security purposes?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The correct answer is C. Although both A and C grant users the specified access. The admin role is overkill for this particular use case. Think about it logically you want a user to be able to use REST API Explorer so you give them access to everything? Makes zero sense. The question asks what's the MINIMUM role required and the answer is C.

Selected Answer: AC
The REST API Explorer is available to users with the rest_api_explorer role or the admin role.

Correct answer is AC, please refer to ServiceNow Docs link = https://developer.servicenow.com/dev.do#!/learn/courses/vancouver/app_store_learnv2_rest_vancouver_rest_integrations/app_store_learnv2_rest_vancouver_inbound_rest_integrations/app_store_learnv2_rest_vancouver_introduction_to_the_rest_api_explorer

Selected Answer: C
Vancouver ebook p. 199: "Users with the rest_api_explorer role can access the REST API"

Selected Answer: C
the "admin" role might indeed have access to the REST API Explorer, but it's not the specific role required for this functionality.

The "rest_api_explorer" role is typically the role designated for accessing and using the REST API Explorer tool specifically. This role provides access to the REST API Explorer without granting all the administrative privileges associated with the "admin" role.

The correct answer depends on the configuration and permissions in your specific ServiceNow instance. While "admin" could potentially access the REST API Explorer, it's not the recommended or specific role for this purpose. If your instance allows "admin" access to the REST API Explorer, that's an instance-specific configuration.

comments.content:
The correct answer is only C not A
The eBook on page 177 does not refer anything about the admin role.

Correct answer is AC, please refer to ServiceNow Docs link = https://developer.servicenow.com/dev.do#!/learn/courses/vancouver/app_store_learnv2_rest_vancouver_rest_integrations/app_store_learnv2_rest_vancouver_inbound_rest_integrations/app_store_learnv2_rest_vancouver_introduction_to_the_rest_api_explorer

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
Explanation: ebook p.177, useres with the rest_api_explorer role (e.g.: developers_) can access the REST API Explorer. Admin role allows acces to Web Services (verified in the course provided SN instance).

questions.question_text: What specific role is required in order to use the REST API Explorer?

choices.B: Create Record on Security Incident state V1
choices.D: Look Up Record on Security Incident state V1
choices.C: Create Response Task set Incident state V1

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Create Response Task set Incident state V1
Correct Answer is C

Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer.
eBook page 276

Selected Answer: C
Explanation: verified in course provided SN instance, under flow designer -> actions -> only "Create Response Task set Incident state V1" shows up.

questions.question_text: Which one of the following reasons best describes why roles for Security Incident Response (SIR) begin with "sn_si"?

choices.B: Because the Security Incident Response application uses a Secure Identity token
choices.C: Because ServiceNow checks the instance for a Secure Identity when logging on to this scoped application
choices.D: Because ServiceNow tracks license use against the Security Incident Response Application
choices.A: Because SIR is a scoped application, roles and script includes will begin with the sn_si prefix
